text: Hypericum umbraculoides is a species of flowering plant, a deciduous shrub in the St. John's wort family, Hypericaceae. It is the sole species in the section Hypericum sect. Umbraculoides.Hypericum MySpecies Taxonomy ==Description== The stems of Hypericum umbraculoides are reddish and its bark is grey. The oblong, papery leaves are sessile, up to long and broad, and paler underneath. The flowers are up to across with 5 golden-yellow petals. Its growth rate and height are unknown.Studies in the genus Hypericum L. (Guttiferae): 3. Sections: 1. Campylosporus to: 6a. Umbraculoides ==Distribution== Hypericum umbraculoides is known to be found only in Oaxaca, Mexico,JStor Plants in arid to semiarid climates.GBIF Online ==References== umbraculoides Category:Plants described in 1985 Category:Flora of Oaxaca Category:Endemic flora of Mexico
title: Hypericum umbraculoides
